section.title: Subject and object pronouns
section.sectiontitle: We use the subject pronouns: I, you and he/she/it before the verb.
section.text1a: I hate dancing. You are great! He works in London. It is awful!
section.sectiontitle2: We use the object pronouns: me, you and him/her/it after the verb.
section.text3a: My friend likes me. Alex loves you. She hates him/her. I don't like it.

section.title: Subject and object pronouns
section.sectiontitle: We use the subject pronouns: we, you and they before the verb.
section.text1a: We like classical music. You don't like shopping. They live in Oxford.
section.sectiontitle2: We use the object pronouns: us, you and them after the verb.
section.text3a: Peter lives with us. My parents like you. I love them.
